title: Evaluation Personnel
author: ''
date: '2022-11-16'
slug: evaluation_personnel
categories: []
tags: []
images:
  - /img/cover.png
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $528.2K
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with Evaluation Personnel. The average
  contract duration was 0.74 years, and the average contract value
  (not including contracts under $10k) was $85.6K. The longest
  contract was 5 years. The largest contract by value (including
  amendments) was $2.0M.
lookup_name: 'EVALUATION PERSONNEL'
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '528.2K'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts: '41'
s431_number_of_contracts_with_amendments: '5'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '12%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage: '127%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments: '1.6'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value: '505.9K'
s424_mean_duration: '0.74'
s421_mean_contract_value: '85.6K'
s425_max_duration: '5'
s422_max_contract_value: '2.0M'
---
